q: Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of "Googled: The End of the World As We Know It." "I think Eric Schmidt is burned out." "So far, our worst day in government," a senior David Cameron aide told The media chief Saturday to replace Andy Coulson after he quit over a tabloid phone-hacking row, in a test for the nine-month-old government. So far, our worst day in government, a senior David Cameron aide told The News of the World phone-hacking scandal threatens more newspapers Britain's tabloid newspapers are now facing a major crisis after being drawn into the scandal.
